answers.answer: Hi and thanks for using the forum.OK, your son needs  to keep a diary of his blood sugars, what and when he is eating, and how much insulin he is taking.  He then needs to take that info to his endocrinologist or whichever doctor is managing his diabetes.  Something needs to be adjusted since his lows are really low and he is waking up with a high sugar.  Good luck.Bridget

question: my son is 26, type 1 since 8, lantus to base line, humalog when he eats, last 3 weeks, not every night but often, takes lantus at 10 pm from 1 to 2 hours later hits a low of 28, fixes comes back to 90 to 120, when he wakes up 300 did not fix this time because that too causes a low, tested 300 at 7, down to 150 at 10 am, you have any ideas he is eating,  testing, working, exerciseing every thing the same
title: night low
